clinical_study.brief_title: Early Changes in Positron Emissions Tomography (PET/CT) Scan as Predictors of Clinical Outcome in NSCLC Treated With EGFR Tyrosin Kinase Inhibitors (TKI)
clinical_study.official_title: Early Changes in 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose Positron Emissions Tomography (18F-FDG-PET/CT) Scan as Predictors of Clinical Outcome in NSCLC Treated With EGFR Tyrosin Kinase Inhibitors (TKI)

brief_summary.textblock:
Erlotinib, an anti-cancer agent targeting the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR), is an active treatment of patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). Effect of treatment is primary seen in patients harboring a mutation in the EGFR. However, 10-15% of patients does not harbor a mutation but respond as well. Identifying these patients is a problem and methods are lacking.
Studies have shown that an early 18F FDG-PET might can predict response and outcome in these patients, but further studies are needed to confirm these findings.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time to progression and latest april 2015 (up to 2 years)
primary_outcome.description: Standardized Uptake Values (SUV) will be used as measurement of 18F-FDG uptake

arm_group.description: An early evaluation 18F-FDG-PET scan after 7-10 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lung Cancer patients with non-small cell histology and stage IV disease
- candidate for erlotinib treatment as first/ second/ third line of treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- severe dyspnoea
